dimension:
16 1/2 x 26 1/4 in. (41.91 x 66.68 cm) (plate)
19 1/2 x 29 3/4 in. (49.53 x 75.57 cm) (sheet, trimmed within platemark)
markings: Watermark: Coat of Arms; Bugnet 1072 about 1600
provenance: (David Tunick, New York); sold to MIA, 1980.
text: Based on Ovid's Metamorphoses, this engraving depicts Apollo's musical victory over Pan. The seated King Timolus, wearing a wreath of oak leaves, judges the contest, while next to him stands King Midas, who having preferred the tunes of Pan's pipes to Apollo's refined play on strings, is punished for his ignorance by being given the ears of an ass.
title: The Judgment of Midas
